boardgame.name: Enchantment by the Sea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of level 3

In the enchanted isles sailors sometimes disappear without a trace. Some are believed to have abandoned the hard work of sailing for the seemingly idyllic lifestyle of the islanders. Others are thought to have been taken by fantastical creatures said to dwell under the ocean or deep in the jungle. Sometimes, it’s a little of both.

Shekalbar, a fey spirit of the tide, lives in a cave by a beach some distance from any village. He worships the kraken believed to dwell in a deep trench not far from the islands. Shekalbar captures travelers to sacrifice to a kraken in the hopes of securing the mighty creature’s favor. To help in this endeavor the hideous fey has recruited a trio of attractive dryads to lure sailors to their doom.

boardgame.name: Descending Into Twilight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Castle of the Twilight Star was recently remedied of its wild kobold infestation… or so was thought. Two months have passed, and the river valley continues to be under assault, the attacks getting ever bolder. Outlying farms found burned to the ground. Heads of cattle and sheep go missing in the night. Travelers disappearing from the roadways, never to return home. Once more Land’s End searches for valiant heroes, to send them back into the nefarious ruins to end this growing threat.

The deadly sequel to The Twilight Star.

Descending Into Twilight is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 13th-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘hard’ to ‘deadly’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Circle of Wrens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fantastic Stables of Abbad-Il, known throughout the region for breeding and training the majestic Androshir, have encountered trouble delivering their prized horses to the royal auctions in Inna-Bogarta. Bandits have been ambushing their caravans, seeming to know every move the Abbad-Il makes. The situation escalated after Rasnan Abbad-Il’s son was injured in the last theft, the third of its kind. For the persons who can safeguard his horses, Rasnan is willing to reward them handsomely.

Circle of Wrens is a combat encounter, ranging from 'medium' to 'hard' in difficulty for four to six players, averaging 4th level.

boardgame.name: Mind Tyrants of the Merciless Moons (Starfinder)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death in the Mind's Eye

The heroes have scored a major victory, but the dark forces arrayed against them will not go down without a fight. Pursuing their fleeing legions to the gas giant Qanna, the heroes arrive on the verdant moon of Itac at the head of a band of Accord forces only to discover that the massive planet’s manifold moons have long been a secret stronghold of the Hegemony forces and the hunters are now the hunted. Worse still, the psychic storms and spatial ripples of the system make escape almost impossible, and to prevail the heroes must launch headlong into a campaign against a dread conqueror set on launching a final desperate assault at the head of a massive army. The heroes at last come face to face with the unspeakable ultari, the grand architects of the Hegemony, and only they can thwart a rogue general’s mad quest for power as they stand against the Mind Tyrants of the Merciless Moons!

Mind Tyrants of the Merciless Moons is an adventure for 17th to 19th-level characters using the Starfinder Roleplaying Game. The latest chapter in the amazing Legendary Planet Adventure Path, a spectacular sword-and-planet saga from Legendary Games blending sci-fi and fantasy, magic and machines with an exciting pulp sensibility and style. Mind Tyrants of the Merciless Moons includes not only a massive interplanetary adventure but also brand-new monsters, magic, and technology, along with a full gazetteer of the domed city of Emirist-Tar and its inhabitants and the weirdling spirit vortices of Qanna, plus an ongoing fiction series. Here you will find amazing adventures that span the stars and plunder the planets in a campaign that takes your heroes to 20th level and beyond! Grab this exotic epic today and Make Your Game Legendary!

This 94-page PDF or 92-page print volume contains the following:

• "Mind Tyrants of the Merciless Moons," a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 17th to 19th-level characters by Tim Hitchcock

• A "Planetary Bestiary" by Tim Hitchcock and Mike Welham, featuring six sensational new monsters: the apocalyptic atoth, sinister ceroptor body snatchers, relentless conveyance golem, leaping karn-tor lizard-folk, howling onaryx (including their mature, dread, and elder variants), and the dread ultari mindlords!

• 7 new technological and magical items like the photon blaster, plasma javelin, particulate synthesizer, and Ithosian golem armor!

• A detailed gazetteer of the domed city-state of Emirist-Tar, home to the purple-skin Alusidain monarchs!

• “The Deadliest Weapon,” the latest chapter in Chris A. Jackson’s ongoing tale of Anasya, an interplanetary adventurer venturing into the void to strike at the heart of the enemy’s war machine!

boardgame.name: The Sundered Ocean
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a race against time as the PCs accept a contract from a doctor to find her stepsister, who is carrying a deadly but still-dormant disease, and administer a cure before a pandemic results. Tracing the target to the ocean world of Yemoja, the heroes quickly find themselves at the intersection of cultural conflict and human depravity. Meanwhile, a gigantic storm threatens to write the final chapter of the world’s history…and the heroes’ lives.

The Sundered Ocean is an adventure designed for use with Cepheus Engine (CE) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it can be ported to other RPG systems or even other genres with minimal work.

boardgame.name: 1515 Delaware Avenue
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simple job getting a rich businessman across town in time to attend a hastily-called business meeting...what could go wrong? Plenty, if the civil unrest occurring in the city has anything to do with it. The heroes must navigate through pockets of rioting citizens and the dangers they create to get the entrepreneur to his destination on time. But the big surprise might be the nature of the business the man is hurrying to undertake…and the PCs find themselves smack in the middle, whether they like it or not!

1515 Delaware Avenue is a short adventure for Midnight Boulevard: 2D6 Adventure in the World of Film Noir, which uses the rules for the Traveller SRD. The adventure is also usable with Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG).

boardgame.name: The World Guide to Barnaynia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Word Guide to Barnaynia - the banana-shaped world!

Barnaynia is the World setting for the extraordinary city of Dunromin, capital of the Land of the Young.

This book is a comprehensive guide to the bizarre World of Barnaynia, the banana-shaped world, including Geology, Geography, Climates, Astronomy, Magic, Gravity, Ecology, Politics, Flora and Fauna, Religions, Maps and Guides as you might expect. But it is much, much more than that.

This book, running to over 200 pages of detail, maps and some cracking pictures, is an entertaining read by itself. Written with a lightness of touch but deep detail it includes ideas and insights into lots of different facets of the Fantasy Role Playing Experience. It is an exercise in World Building taken to the extreme.

But if you are looking for new ideas, encounters, NPC groups and monsters without the hassle of working out all the details yourself, Barnaynia can fit that requirement too!

If you need a ready-made world in which your set of dungeons and terrains can be set then Barnaynia is perfect for you, too.

On a Human scale it is a world comparable to any other. There are trees, mountains, seas, cities, empires, dungeons, ruins and everything else you would expect to find in any FRPG setting. The bizarre nature of the planet need have little bearing on the game at all, but it’s always there. The vast possibilities the strangeness present will gently become apparent to the adventurers as they explore the world.

Yes, they can fall off the edge of the world. Lots of things do all the time. There are ecosystems, businesses and hobbies built around the process.
Yes, you can explore space and visit the planets, or the Moon, even the Sun, although you probably won’t like it there.
Yes, there is a practically endless warren of dungeons, caves, tunnels, temples, cities, rivers, lakes and civilisations throughout the crust and core of the planet to explore.
Yes, there is a feast monsters, new and old, throughout the world; along with information about the societies, technologies and gods of those same races.
Yes, there are deep mysteries to be explored and solved.
And yes! There is lots and lots (and LOTS) of fun to be had helping your players to discover it all for themselves.


Still not enough for you? Well, we’ve managed to fit a LOT in the 200+ pages:

Four detailed world maps plus a cross-section, climactic schematic and astronomical view;
Several human civilisations detailed and ready to interact with;
Demihuman group descriptions and details, including two variations on the theme of Elves;
Humanoids detailed in exquisite glory, including gods, racial preferences, ambitions and powers, not to mention more information about the sinister Great Orcs;
Appendices on new Magic-Items, NPCs and monsters;
Extensive lists of gods and religious preferences, including several creation myths.


Barnaynia is not just another World Guide; it is a complete role-playing environment of a radically different but VERY practical form. AND it’s an entertaining and thought-provoking read as well!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Project Cars 3
boardgame.description:
OWN YOUR JOURNEY
RACE TO EARN CREDITS AND XP TO
BUY AND OWN HUNDREDS OF CARS
CUSTOMIZE YOUR CARS’ LIVERIES
PERSONALIZE YOUR DRIVERS
UPGRADE CARS WITH REALISTIC PERFORMANCE PARTS

FEEL EACH MOMENT
FULLY SCALABLE ASSISTS FOR ALL SKILL LEVELS
NEW TYRE MODEL FOR CONVINCING & FUN HANDLING
24-HOUR CYCLE, DYNAMIC ALL-SEASONS, ALL-WEATHER RACING
UNRIVALLED CONTROLLER EXPERIENCE
VISCERAL SENSE OF SPEED
INTENSE CRASH EFFECTS AND AUTHENTIC CAR-CONTACT

EARN EVERY WIN
NEW AND DEEPLY ENGAGING CAREER MODE
BATTLE YOUR WAY UP FROM WEEKEND WARRIOR TO RACING LEGEND
NEW & COMPELLING MULTIPLAYER AND COMMUNITY MODES
FUN & EXCITING DAILY CHALLENGES

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2020 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Winner
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Thaumaturgic Codex Book II: Spells
Thaumaturgic Codex: Book II (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturgic Codex: Book II presents 20 unique spells for use with the 5e d20 RPG system.

Most of these spells first appeared in our other OGL titles, dating back to 2003, but have been gathered here and revised, improved, and updated to the new system. Others are new and were created for this edition. Included in this collection are spells up to 6th level such as:

Beastly Transformation: Turn your pet cat or dog into a deadly beast!

Storm Door: Need to thicken the "fog of war?" Open a storm door and start filling the area with ferocious demons!

Creeping Shadows: Who needs friends when your enemies are delusional?

Concussive Blast: Surrounded? We've got a spell for that. Enemies are better when they are 20 feet away, prone, and bleeding.

Shadow Spray: Seven shades of darkness spray from your hands and render your enemies cursed, paralized, or dead!

boardgame.name: Desert Angel Fiasco
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today an enchanted flying ship, the Desert Angel, will attempt to cross the uncharted Great Sand Sea. The Vahid Trading Company has convinced enough merchants to fill its hold with silks and spices, as well as some other strange odds and ends.

But Master Vahid is very worried about the safety of his new ship and crew, as well as the cargo. He is looking for trustworthy mercenaries to provide security on the Desert Angel’s maiden voyage. Payment upon (safe) arrival!

ADVENTURE TYPE: Linear / Social / Combat / Mystery / Low Level / One-Shot

DESIGN NOTES

This adventure is intended for low-level characters (1-3). It is primarily geared for social encounters and combat, with some mystery-solving as well.

It runs 2 to 5 hours. (Intended as a one-shot.)

Players ride a flying ship across the desert. Monsters attack. Passengers plot treachery. Mysterious locations appear.

You can keep the tone serious or play up this ridiculous sequence of disasters for laughs.

There are numerous NPCs as well as unique magical items and other treasures.

NOTE: This adventure was written first for 5e and then converted into an OSR version. In the OSR version, you will find (a very few) 5e-isms and artifacts.

INCLUDES: DM notes, NPC notes, location descriptions, dialogue prompts, stat blocks, original creatures and treasures, and maps.

KEYWORDS: desert, voyage, ship, journey, disaster, sabotage, murder, mutiny, eldritch horror, scorpion, mummy, wasp, pirate, crater, pyramid, zombie, phoenix

boardgame.name: Adventures in Midshire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the hamlet of Midshire, a perfect place to start your adventures with the Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game.

Monsters lurk in the wilderness, mysterious caves hold unknown treasure to be found, and restless spirits haunt an abandoned manor house. It looks like Midshire is in need of adventurers.
boardgame.rpg: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Gate of Teeth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gate of Teeth, a 2nd level adventure for Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, which introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. The Gate of Teeth uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this RPG adventure.

An ancient alien artifact has been discovered on a mysterious planet. A scientist needs adventurers to research the artifact, but with one problem ... the planet lies within the forbidden territory of a strange alien race. So strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Blood on the Snow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An aging Vidjeri commander calls the heroes to his hidden mountain lodge so that they can transport intelligence vital to the free Vidjeran resistance. The commander has uncovered a spy ring working to break the resistance and tasks the heroes with getting the data to Casabelle safely. Getting back to Casabelle alive may be harder than the heroes anticipate, as Rinwaldi commandoes hunt them down and the weather takes a turn for the deadly.

A quick and easy jumpstart adventure for the MYTHIC D6 Terra Oblivion game world.

Included:

A 5-page adventure
Adversary Write-Ups
Pre-generated player heroes

boardgame.name: Hand of Fate: Ordeals ‚Äì Special Edition
boardgame.description:
You, traveler, have been chosen to play The Game, an ancient artifact of terrible power that can twist reality and call forth horrors from the past to test its players. You now sit at the table before Kallas, the current master of The Game, to play for his entertainment and your life. You enter the fray with only a rusty ax and the most basic of skills. Trace the steps of your past and explore the vast lands of the kingdom. Hone your abilities, outwit your opponents, and slay the greatest of foes in order to claim the title of Hero.

Hand of Fate: Ordeals is an adventure deck-building game for 1–4 players that can be played in competitive or cooperative modes.


In addition to the base game content, the Special Edition includes new game modes (Dealer Mode, Hard Mode, Endless Mode), The Lich Boss, Traps, Special Minions (Goblins, Mages, Golems and The Minotaur).
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Hand of Fate: Ordeals ‚Äì Royalty Expansion

boardgame.name: Warlock! Kingdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the Kingdom!

This supplement for Warlock, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming, explores the Kingdom.
Part 1: Gazetteer of the Evening Lands, the western part of the Kingdom.
Part 2: Focus on Grim Biskerstaf, a thriving port city on the mighty river Vessen.
Come to the Kingdom, intrigue and adventure awaits!

Most of the content of this book is system agnostic, so it may be used with any fantasy roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Darkness at Nekemte
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the fetid swamp lies abandoned Nekemte, ancient serpent man city of the Jade Empire and home to the royal house of Nekemte - cruel, tyrannical sorcerers and practitioners of necromancy, corrupted cultists of Yul. The great swamp consumed Nekemte following the fall of the Jade Empire, its buildings crumbling and falling into decay. Throughout the centures, terror of the sepent man sorcery hung over the ruins, and shadowy creatures stalked the crumbling edifices at night, feeding on the warmth of the living. A party of looters recently dared the ruins and stole into the lower tombs where they unearthed the Arimax Stone, an artifact of great power, in the process unwittingly awakening an ancient, slumbering menace...

Darkness at Nekemte is a Gunderholfen campaign setting expansion module with a dark sword & sorcery feel. It can be set in the Gunderholfen megadungeon campaign setting or run as a once-off in any campaign; Gunderholfen is not required to run this adventure. Darkness at Nekemte is designed to be used with OSRIC and other OSR games. It includes:

Approximately 70 keyed encounter locations and sub-areas
A swamp and ruins adventure site
A main dungeon level
Wilderness encounters and locations to facilitate swamp-based hexcrawls
19 new monsters, 15 new spells and 12 new magic items
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Aventuras de 1 P√°gina: A Filha do B√°rbaro
The Barbarian's Daughter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 page adventures is a serie of adventures to you adapt to any RPG system. A perfect plot to start a new campaing or to put in between of your adventures in the most different worlds!

boardgame.name: Dracula vs. Redeemer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Dracula VS Redeemer provides two characters for your Mutants & Masterminds games: a villain, Dracula, and a hero, Redeemer.

Dracula is the undisputed King of Vampires, a medieval warrior prince looking to carve out an undead empire in a world of superheroes.

Redeemer is the Catholic Church's secret weapon against supernatural evil, as the latest holy warrior in a long line of witch hunters.

Each character is accompanied by three adventure ideas to make it easier to work them into your game.

boardgame.name: Urban Chase
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the urban chases in your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Scriptorium: Field of Flowers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure set in Leganti the capital of Solda (in the Dragon Reaches of Marakush) in the early spring.

Low level characters should be able to manage this scenario. Its a sandbox style so have fun and feel free to expand on the material presented.

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game ‚Äì Kree Fanatic Modular Set
boardgame.description:
Add this seven card modular set to any Marvel Champions Scenario to add The Accuser to your game, and ramp the difficulty up to its maximum level. These seven cards feature one Side Scheme, the Ronan The Accuser Minion, one Attachment, and 4 Treachery cards (2 copies each of 2 cards). Ronan is the first minion who, like a Scenario Villain, has hit points that adjust based on the number of players.

This set is available for print-and-play from FFG's official website: https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/marvel-champi....
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions ‚Äì The Card Game

boardgame.name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Taros Air War Campaign Book
boardgame.description:
Taros was an unassuming mining world nestled in the Ultima Segmentum, faithfully toiling in the service of the Imperium of Man for thousands of years… or so it seemed. The T’au Empire quietly began trading with the planetary governor – when this treachery was discovered, the Imperium’s response was relentless and brutal.

This beautiful 96-page hardback campaign book includes the following (plus loads more):

- A matt-finish cover with gloss spot finish highlights, plus a ribbon bookmark in drab green.
- The full Aeronautica Imperialis game rules, including how to build your force using Squadron Lists, perform Ace Manoeuvres, field different classes of aircraft and unleash ground defences. Learn how to manoeuvre your aircraft, adjust their altitude and change speed while avoiding the risks of crashing and breaking up (if you exceed your maximum speed). There are even rules for special manoeuvres including landing, taxiing, and taking-off.
- In-depth background on the war to retake Taros from established T’au Empire armies, in particular the air war and daring low-altitude skirmishes.
- New rules for Flying at Low Altitude, Terrain Height, Collisions, Rolling Areas of Engagement, and Falling Behind.
- Five scenarios, including The Dogfight, The Chase, Subterranean Assault, Sky-Fortress Attack and Canyon Attack Run.
- Rules for campaign play, including how to replace destroyed aircraft and level up your pilots as they gain experience.
- Squadron Lists, providing details of the following aircraft, including their weapon options and special rules: Avenger Strike Fighter, Lightning Strike Fighter, Imperial Arvus Lighter, Valkyrie Assault Carrier, Vulture Gunship, Barracuda, Tiger Shark and Remora Drone.
- Rules for ground assets such as the Hydra Flak Battery, Basilisk Anti-Aircraft Emplacement, KV 126 Skyfire Platform and KV 129 Stormfury Platform.
- Rules for the following legendary ace pilots: Flight Commander Megana Ayce, Flight Lieutenant Dyce Vander, Kor’la Kae O’ar and Kor’la Dor’n O’ka – each including a profile of their aircraft and special rules.
- Example colour schemes of Imperial Navy, Astra Militarum and T’au Air Caste aircraft.
- A reference page showing the eight different manoeuvres aircraft can take, as well as a 2-page quick reference containing the key game rules.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces ‚Äì Astra Militarum and Imperial Navy Cards
Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces ‚Äì T'au Air Caste Cards
Aeronautica Imperialis: Taros Area of Engagement Board
Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance ‚Äì Emperor's Blessing Card
Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance ‚Äì Ghost Relic Avenger Card

boardgame.name: Alder's Blood Prologue
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A prologue for Alder's Blood where Charles struggles to stay alive, just like everyone else in this cruel world

boardgame.name: The Wanderer's Guide
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

An immersive fantasy atlas featuring multiple perspectives. Ranging from breathtaking world views, intricate city designs, to detailed building interiors and dungeons.

boardgame.name: Catan: Kosmonauten 5/6
Catan: Starfarers ‚Äì 5-6 Player Extension
Catan: Sternenfahrer ‚Äì Erg√§nzung 5-6 Spieler
boardgame.description:
Catan: Starfarers – 5-6 Player Extension contains all the components needed to conduct games of Catan: Starfarers with up to six players. A new Pilot 1/Pilot 2 turn-taking system ensures that players stay more engaged by allowing building and moving in between active turns.

In addition to new player pieces, motherships, and additional space sectors, this extension introduces a mysterious alien civilization: The Travelers. Players can strike up trade alliances with the Travelers to benefit from their supernatural powers!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Catan: Starfarers 5-6 Player Expansion

listing.notes: In shrink wrap
Opened, never played.

boardgame.name: Titans Of Eden
boardgame.description:
"Welcome to a world of total warfare. Your wizards used to be powerful enough to hold your enemies at bay, but ever since the monks discovered the power contained in The Six Great Temples, everything has fallen to chaos, and none of your industrial weapons can restore peace to your lands. Your only hope for survival rests in forbidden and forgotten magic: To save your people from extinction, you must harness the power of the four elements and awaken the protector of Eden."

Titans Of Eden is a fast-paced deck-building card game for 2-6 players. Each player starts with a deck of basic cards, and has to choose each turn whether they want to play powerful cards to battle their opponents, or energy-granting cards that add elemental cards to their deck for future turns.

There are four main elements in Eden, and the strategies and abilities of each element are strong against one other element. This leads to fundamentally balanced gameplay: For example, if your opponent is going hard on an Ice strategy, you can use Fire cards to neutralize their cards and counter their moves. To do well in Titans Of Eden, you must build a balanced deck that can effectively respond to your opponents' actions.

At the end of each turn, you battle your opponents. Once you destroy their three temples, you win the game. With this victory condition, you have to play to win, every turn, because you're never more than 3 turns from victory, and never more than three turns from defeat.

Titans Of Eden includes a classic (Dominion-style) deck-building format for casual play, and a constructed format for competitive play. In the constructed format, each player builds a spellbook before playing, which they use to take on their opponents.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cosmic Encounter Duel: Gamemat
boardgame.description:
Stage your instellar battles in cinematic fashion with the Cosmic Encounter Duel Gamemat! This 26” by 36” features vibrant original art from Cosmic Encounter Duel atop a high-quality, slip-resistant rubber base. As you become immersed in your cosmic clashes, you can display your cards and components in a clean, organized fashion while protecting them from stains and spills, whether you're playing in a tournament or just around the kitchen table. Whichever species you choose to lead in their fight to join the Cosmic Citizenship Council, this playmats will help keep your cards and components protected, ensuring that the focus stays where it belongs—on your games!
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: One-Page Dungeons Zine
boardgame.description:
Fish in the Pot One-Page Dungeons Zine

The collection features 15 short dungeons for your RPG table. Each dungeon is quick to read, simple to prep, and fun to play. Each Dungeon includes a map and full descriptions of the challenges and surprises that the Player Characters will face all on a single page. Some Dungeons will include a new, feature monster designed specifically for the Dungeon. Others may include strange new game mechanisms or super rare magic items.

Fish in the Pot One-Page Dungeons are all compatible with the current rules of the World's Most Popular Role-Playing Game. However, these dungeons attempt to shift the focus from usual dungeon tropes. The fifteen dungeons collected here vary greatly in theme, challenge, and flavor. What they all have in common is a sense of whimsy and ease of pre-game prep.

Fish in the Pot One-Page Dungeons leave room for Game Masters to insert critical, story specific plot items or fun, PC specific rewards that cannot be contemplated by the Dungeon Designer. Need a dramatic reveal for your maguffin? Wanna give the party's fighter an extra special magic sword? Take advantage of the opportunities made available in these One-Page Dungeons.

boardgame.name: Helionox: Chronicles
boardgame.description:
Helionox: Chronicles is a solo/cooperative movement based deck building board game set in the Helionox universe. It combines asymmetric starting builds, tactical in-game deck construction, engine building, resource management, and action selection.

In the distant future, terrible events plague the solar system against the backdrop of a slowly dying sun. 1-4 players act cooperatively as the Architects of the future, vying for influence against the Shadow Syndicate, a clandestine organization of wealthy ruthless political, religious, and corporate entities. As the sun rages and the events become increasingly catastrophic, the need to prepare for the future is all too evident. However, where the Architects hope to protect all life, the Shadow focuses solely on the interests of the wealthy.

Influence is the path to victory and can be gained in many ways. Each player begins with a player board that serves as their ship's command center and a ship miniature to show your current location on the game board. A unique deck of cards and access to a faction based market allows players to add new tech and operatives to their decks which help create powerful combos and offer unique scoring opportunities. Three building types can be dropped on locations throughout the solar system (the game board). These supply engine building and strategic infrastructure. Each player board, deck, and building setup can be customized at the beginning of the game and used with distinctive Architects for a vast array of combinations and asymmetric game play.

Can you and the other Architects gain more influence than the Shadow Syndicate? Craft your deck with powerful faction cards, explore and exploit the system’s worlds, and gain influence so you can lead civilization to a new beginning in the wake of the Helionox…

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Cacciatori di Morti
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Ecco il manuale che approfondisce il mondo duro e tetro in cui vivono i cacciatori di morti, che, dal giorno del giudizio, non hanno mai smesso di combattere!

English translation:
Here is the manual that delves into the harsh and gloomy world in which the hunters of the dead live, who, since the day of judgment, have never stopped fighting!

boardgame.name: Chlorination
boardgame.description:
Chlorination is the name of the game and you get to be a professional swimmer. To categorize it, Chlorination is a strategic, card-based board game that consists of a number of competitions. During the game, you’ll need to choose your actions carefully. You’ll also need to plan your economy and most importantly you’ll need to practice enough to win the competitions throughout the game. The recommended age is from 12 years old and the game is for 2-5 players.

The game consists of eight competitions in total, two in each swimstyle; backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle. Before and between every competition, every player get five actions. The actions can be found on the game board and you can either work to earn coins, you'll need coins to pay competition fees and for other things. But you can also practice using skill cards. Whenever you work you earn a certain number of coins and skill cards depending on where you choose to work. Whenever you practice you move your cube on the score table the number that skill card shows. The player with the highest skill level in the the swimstyle of a competition wins and the player with the most medals wins the game in the end. A gold, a silver and a bronze medal are handed out every competition.

Watch the tutorial to learn more about the game of Chloriantion.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Unconditional Surrender! Western Campaigns
boardgame.description:
Unconditional Surrender! Western Campaigns (USWC) is an strategic-level game covering World War 2 campaigns fought between the Axis and Western Allied factions in Western Europe. With its emphasis on force projection, players focus on the big picture of managing their military forces. Using simple mechanics and low on-map counter density, players easily handle the action without complicated subsystems or tall stacks of counters.

Plucked from the game Unconditional Surrender! WW2 in Europe (USE), USWC provides shorter, smaller footprint scenarios for those wanting to play the Unconditional Surrender! design but lacking the space and time needed for the much larger USE. USWC also serves as an alternative way to teach it to other players. Owners of USE that have the space and time for it, do not have to buy this game. However, it may be worth it, if you are looking for something much more portable to bring somewhere else to play or for an inexpensive gift for a wargaming friend.

DESIGN HIGHLIGHTS:

Low On-Map Counter Density: The number of counters on the map is incredibly low.
Simple Stacking: No more than one of the same type of unit per hex.
No Factors on Counters: No combat or movement factors on counters.
Single Combat System: One combat resolution sequence and Combat Results Table covers all types of combat, yet the results differ for air or ground combat.
Integrated Movement & Combat System: Units move and fight in a combined activation.
Ergonomically Friendly: Easily fits in extremely limited gaming space.
"Use it or lose it." Economic System: Simple math with minimal record keeping.
Easy to Modify: The relatively simple mechanics make it easy to modify the game.
Unconditional Surrender! World War 2 in Europe Compatibility: The ground and air units, event markers, and combat system are the same in both games. The scenarios are similar except for the elements that were abstracted. If you later decide to play USE, you will have additional rules to learn but little to unlearn.

TIME SCALE: Monthly Turns
MAP SCALE: 30 to 40 miles per hex
UNIT SCALE: Army, Fleet, or Wing
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 2


COMPONENT LIST
6 8.5"x11" maps
1 Countersheet
1 Rules Booklet
1 Play Book
2 11"x17" Player Aid cards
1 Faction Card
2 6-sided dice
Game Box

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare ‚Äì Ack Ack, Sinjin & Avery
boardgame.description:
Whether through Strength, Intelligence or plain dumb Luck some Raiders survive everything the Wasteland throws at them and come back for more.

Sinjin and his right hand woman Avery head up a gang of Raiders that often cause trouble in the Goodneighbour area. Bringing high ranged ability to the table and some unique buffs to support their followers they make good leader choices for any game.

Ack-Ack and her gang set up base in the Olivia Satellite Station. Known for her raids on local farms and settlements, always punctuated by the rapid fire of her favourite Minigun.

This boxed set contains three 32mm scale multi-part high quality resin Raider miniatures, each with a unique scenic base, to allow players to expand their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare games.

boardgame.name: Raid on St Michel
boardgame.description:
Raid on St Michel links five Table Top Teasers or scenarios together in a mini campaign. They can be played as stand alone battles or sequentially with each impacting n the next.

The Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS) are long term adversaries. The Lorraine Forces are modelled on those of France with not dissimilar uniforms, while the VFS - the United Free Provinces - are a fairly tight agglomeration of small principalities, republics, city states and so on, united to oppose Lorraine. The VFS uniforms, inspired by a number of European armies, provide a colourful contrast to the white of Lorraine.

This action takes place in a fairly remote northern area of the border between the two adversaries, the line of demarcation being the River Kneller. On the Lorraine side of the border, to the south, is the small province of St.Michel which unknowingly is about to become the focus of enemy operations.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Trajan: GeekUp Bit Set
boardgame.description:
We know these amazing GeekUp bits for Trajan would be Senate approved!

Please note: All of the tokens in this set have a pearlescence finish except for the +2 tokens. This pearlescence finish is not visible on all pieces in the stock photo.

The pieces are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4-color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

Twilight Struggle is masterpiece of both history and two-player gaming, and well deserving of its spot in the BGG Top 10 Games for well over a decade. Now this classic is getting an upgrade worthy of its accolades, with a GeekUp set to replace all 260 of the punchboard tokens from the most recent 7th printing.

The pieces are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4-color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

This GeekUp set contains all 260 of the tokens on the two punchboards from the deluxe edition, all 15x15mm squares with 4mm thickness:

114 US Influence/Control tokens (values 1-8, US Space Race, and US Military Ops)
117 USSR Influence/Control tokens (value 1-8, USSR Space Race, and USSR Military Ops)

1 DEFON status
1 Turn marker

3 Nuclear Symbol tokens)

Action Round marker
1 NASA 2nd card marker

Just as chocolate was an integral part of Mayan culture and commence, so too will these GeekUp bits become essential to your play of the game Teotihuacan! These two-sided bits feature additional artwork from the game's original artist, Odysseas Stamoglou, on one side and an engraving of the Mayan glyph for cacao on the other.

boardgame.name: Starward
boardgame.description:
Author summary

"Starward" mixes science fantasy into the gooey sword & sorcery of your Rogue Scroll or Swords Without Master game. Starships engaged in dogfights! Dueling laser swords! Alien worlds! Trusty companions and wandering tones!

boardgame.name: Das Beinhaus von Sedlec: Henker-Erweiterung
Calaveras de Sedlec: Los Verdugos
Skulls of Sedlec: Executioners
boardgame.description:
Skulls of Sedlec: Executioners is a 6-card expansion to Skulls of Sedlec that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.


In life, the Executioner's duty was to protect society by by delivering the death sentence of the condemned. In death, Executioners wish to be surrounded by their handiwork, the abundant skulls of Criminals that they undid.

This 6-card expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the deadly Executioner. Punish your opponents and score big by attaching Executioners to groups of Criminals. Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

—description from the publisher


Released in the June 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

listing.notes: INCLUDES FIRST THREE NON-SOLO EXPANSIONS (CASTLE GAURDS, EXECUTIONERS, & POETS)

boardgame.name: Calaveras de Sedlec: Ostensorios
Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance
boardgame.description:
Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance is a 6-card expansion for Skulls of Sedlec, allowing for solo play.


The Bone Monstrance is one of the ornate sculptures that decorate the inside of the Sedlec Ossuary. As a monk, you will toil away at exhuming graves and arranging skulls into stacks. As an artist though, you will need to be very creative to sculpt a truly original piece that will please the royal family!

This solo expansion celebrates these works of art by allowing you to create six unique features alongside a standard, pyramid-shaped stack of skulls. Each play session adds a condition that will make this undertaking a challenge for even the sharpest skull-stacker!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeon Academy: The Desert of Illusions
boardgame.description:
Young adventurer, this excursion will not be without danger! Sandstorm hike, deadly scorpions and poisonous snakes ... Whether you are a lucky Prince,
Assassin or Illusionist, you will have to surpass yourself to get your graduation. After the dungeon, after the Lost Forest, it's time to test your skills in the heart of the desert. Have a nice trip !

Game play and components :
You embark on the exploration of 4 different floors: at each start of the round, randomly create a level by rolling 16 dice to obtain a square of 4 out of 4 dice. Armed with your Adventure sheet and the specific abilities of your character, draw your journey through the level while respecting travel constraints. Try to earn glory points and defeat small and large monsters. And don't forget to collect life and mana potions to stay alive! The fastest will have more choices when selecting their treasure, at the end of each level, and will thus be able to acquire more glory points, ensuring you victory ... and the graduation.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Mocarstwa
boardgame.description:
Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Explosive Barrels
boardgame.description:
This set includes 4 Explosive Barrel terrain pieces, as well as a brand new Mission (Blast 'em Back to Hell) to use them in your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Blast 'em Back to Hell - An overwhelming horde of creatures is approaching fast from all directions! If not stopped, they will overrun the entire area in a matter of hours, destroying everything in their path. Gathering up as many explosives as you can, you're only gonna get one shot at this. Collapsing one or two paths won't do, you need to set traps and lure them in to blow as many of these creatures back to hell as you can... and hope that you have enough firepower to clean up whatever is left.

With a new mechanic for generating a Random Fixed Map and an 'insane' difficulty mode using Epic Threats for 5-6 Heroes playing the Mission, this Explosive Barrels set lets you pile more Enemies from your collection on the board at once than ever before! It will assuredly put more bang into your Adventures!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Ancient Gate
boardgame.description:
The Limited Edition Ancient Gate of Targa!

This deluxe resin terrain piece depicts a massive and ancient stone portal, flanked by monolithic alien statues on either side of the shimmering gate! Constructed eons ago by the Ancients of the Targa Plateau, these powerful portals could create stable gateways to OtherWorlds across all of time and space. A stunning centerpiece, this set also includes a brand new Mission (When Worlds Collide) using the Ancient Gate in your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Mission: When Worlds Collide - An ancient alien portal has been unearthed in the hills and accidentally activated by a local group of miners, creating a shimmering gateway in the weathered stone portal. With an arc of crackling energy, the alien Void Crystals powering the gate overloaded and shattered, scattering fragments of crystal across space and time! As the gate flickers, cycling its connection through several different worlds, it wreaks havoc across dimensions. The Heroes must race against time to venture through the gate and recover the fragments of shattered Void crystal from across worlds before the stone portal overloads and explodes!

This set includes an all-new scenario set piece for Shadows of Brimstone: the mysterious and alien ANCIENT GATE from the Targa Plateau, plus a new Mission that utilizes multiple Worlds and a brand new Void Storm Depth Event chart to add extra challenge to Adventures. As the Heroes hunt for the fragments of a shattered Void crystal, the malfunctioning Ancient Gate shifts its connection between worlds and begins to merge them, crossing the World Card effects and Enemies of one World onto the next!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress ‚Äì Forbidden Darkness Supplement
boardgame.description:
Description from the publisher:

The war-torn battlefields of Feudal Japan are home to brutal fighting and creatures of myth and legend. For even the cunning warrior, it is difficult to keep corruption at bay and your heart pure of dishonor. As the war of the Dragon rages on, the Darkness grows emboldened, always ready to strike.

This 15-card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone features an all new set of Darkness cards, themed for Feudal Japan! With effects that deal in Corruption, manipulate Grit, and make your Travel after the Adventure more dangerous, as well as making Enemies you fight both Ruthless and Soulless as they hunt you down, these new Darkness cards add new and dangerous challenges to your adventures.

Forbidden Darkness is a brand new set of cards that were not previously available through any Kickstarter project.

CONTENTS

Card #539 An Age of War ×2
Card #540 Taste of Corruption ×2
Card #541 Local Legends ×2
Card #542 Dark Soul
Card #543 War of the Dragon
Card #544 Bloodthirsty
Card #545 Shadow Clan Assassins
Card #546 Shame of Failure
Card #547 Born of Darkness
Card #548 Evil on the Move
Card #549 Emboldened
Card #550 Dishonored / Gravely Dishonored (Rule Card)

boardgame.name: Vanessa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vanessa is a small world sheathed in thick ice which hides a liquid life-bearing ocean underneath. But the ice can’t hide the heated desire for corporate interests to plunder the moon of its abundant natural resources, never mind the objections of the coldly rational scientists who staff the world’s research station. So far, the cold war between the scientists and the miners has been confined to courtrooms and legislative chambers, but the battle for the world’s destiny is slowly heating up as each side refuses to back down from its plans.

Port of Call: Vanessa introduces Cepheus Engine and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) players to this hidden ocean world. Inside is an overview of how the information would appear in a library database, physical planetary and system information, a brief history, a look at its technology and society, a map of the planet, a map of the system, and an illustration of the research station.

Port of Call: Vanessa. The cold environment is heating up quickly.

boardgame.name: Liuxiang Liu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Tech Whiz…

“Hi, Lulu!”

Liuxiang Liu stopped her nanotorch and allowed herself a silent sigh before forcing herself to acknowledge the intern and his imprudent greeting. She carefully placed the nanotorch down on the workbench beside the equipment that she’d now be delayed in repairing and gave the young man far more attention than he deserved.

She fixed the intern with an arctic stare. He knew what that look meant.

“I’m sorry…Liuxiang.”

The stare didn’t waver.

“Miss Liu?”

She finally thawed her gaze. “You’re tardy, Ron. Punctuality is the hallmark of good work, wouldn’t you agree?”

“Y-yes, Miss Liu,” Ron stammered.

She picked up the nanotorch. “I’ll thank you to get to work on that inverse anion booster,” she used the tool to indicate the device on a nearby workbench. “I need it analyzed and completed by 1200; by then I’ll have another assignment for you.” Without another word, she returned to her work.

Liuxiang Liu is a talented technician from a backwater planet who is motivated by a inner drive to succeed and the advice of her beloved and respected father. But a dark incident in per past wrote a chapter of her life that she struggles with to this day, and that might eventually prove to be yet another impediment to her goals.

Dossier: Liuxiang Liu is a short character sketch for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work. The file offers a brief character sketch, a personality sketch, character motivation, character stats usable for CE and the OSFRPG, and suggestions for using this coldly rational technician in the Referee’s own universe.

boardgame.name: The Haunting of Eliuska Manor (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you survive the horrors of the mysterious Eliuska Manor?

The haunted house: a setting that has fascinated us since we first moved from the open wilds into homes contained in stone. Take your adventurers into a terrifying mansion filled with all the things we love about horror movies, haunted houses, and spooky adventures! The adventurers have been asked to investigate a lord’s manor after another team of heroes went in and never returned. They will follow the clues deep into the bowels of the giant manor hoping to unlock its gruesome secrets.

The Haunting of Eliuska Manor is an adventure for 4 to 6 adventurers of level 4

DM Synopsis

Strange things have been seen on the grounds of Eliuska Manor, and the Wanderers have sent the adventurers to investigate, and, if necessary, eliminate any threats to Kowal and its citizens.

Gregor Eliuska (El - eww - ska) is a Kowal merchant who has devoted years of study to the dark arts in search of power. Now, he has gone too far.

He amassed a fortune from corrupt dealings and used it to convert his old hunting manor into a sprawling mansion. Here, he has studied forbidden books, cast cursed spells, and summoned demons. When he summoned an illarth, a powerful demon from the Navirim, he became its slave. The illarth feeds on sentient minds, and it has used Gregor, the mansion, and others to lure unsuspecting victims to its grasp. The mansion adventure has many levels, each leading closer to the bottom, into the alien lair of the illarth.

The grounds are haunted by a fear demon, preventing any escape once the adventurers enter the mansion. Will the adventurers find a way to neutralize the illarth or will they become its next meal?

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The haunted house: a setting that has fascinated us since we first moved from the open wilds into homes contained in stone. boardgame.name: Simon Sorry
boardgame.description:
Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. As with the Simon game, players watch the lights on the electronic game unit and remember the pattern so they can repeat the sequences. If correct, the unit lets players know how many spaces to move their pawn. Like with the Sorry! game, players can chase, race, bump, and slide their way around the gameboard, racing to be the first to get all their pawns into Home

Includes: gameboard, 12 Sorry! pawns, Simon game unit, base, and instructions.

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 3, Issue 14 - Apr 1994)
boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert (adventures)

boardgame.name: Haunticulture
boardgame.description:
Creepstone Manor is empty again, the last ‘guest’ running screaming into the night as Tinker, Creak, Giggle and Boo celebrate their victory.

But Spookie won’t let them rest on their laurels! The house is secure, so it’s time to turn your attention further afield and sort the gardens of Creepstone Manor.

Unfortunately, being a ghost has certain disadvantages. For one, handling a spade is tricky when your hand keeps passing straight through it! But help is on hand. The resurrected gardeners from the Manor’s heyday have returned to lend their rotted expertise to you. Use your crew of Zombies, Skeletons and Ghouls to grab plants and ornaments for your part of the garden; hire new crew members such as werewolves and vampires to boost your work and get those extra flowers planted before the night is over. But beware! Only those ghosts who show the greatest aesthetic eye will impress Spookie and be the best undead Haunticulturist.

During their turn, players will bid for plant and ornament tiles using the monster cards they have in hand. Each monster has a gardening skill number (the higher the better) and up to two special abilities. During bidding, players will need to consider both the row and column their monsters are in when trying to grab those tokens. On top of this, if a player can play the third in a row of a particular monster type (say zombie or skeleton) they'll be rewarded with a boosted special ability on that card.

Players also can earn gold in the game, either through clearing 'junk' from their player board or various monster abilities. These can be used to hire 'special monsters' that have enhanced skills and abilities which the player keeps from round to round, replacing the basic monsters the player starts with.

After bidding, each player will place any plant tokens onto their personal flower bed (even the bad ones that score negative points!). How these are placed will affect the players' scores at the end of the game. How each plant will score can be varied by the players, changing the challenge from game to game.

Players can also use the gold earned earlier to build any ornament tiles earned during bidding. Do you fill up on gnomes to get the highest score, or shoot for the all-or-nothing fountain?

Finally, players can earn points for a secret objective card selected at the beginning of the game. These feature a way to score that is unique to that player, and can be the difference between winning and losing.

The game ends after four rounds, at which point each player tallies up their score for plants, ornaments and secret objectives with the highest score being crowned Head Haunticulturist!

Haunticulture also includes rules for solo play

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 3, Issue 15 - Aug 1994)
boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert (adventures)

boardgame.name: Rapid Fire! Able Archer 83-84
boardgame.description:
Rapid Fire! Able Archer 83-84: A Cold War rules adaptation for use with Rapid Fire!

Modifications to Rapid Fire!:

Tank and Anti-Tank firing. (D6 roll changed to a D10),
Addition of Anti-Tank Guided Weapons such as TOW, Sagger missiles,
Air support works which is listed in the Aircraft Sequence of Action,
Rules for special artillery munitions, counter-battery fire and new tactics,
new vehicle stats for IFVs (Warrior, Bradley and BMD-2) and tanks,
Cold War scenarios,
two quick reference sheets that incorporate the rule changes.


These rules also work perfectly well for the Arab Israeli wars of 1973 and the Invasion of Lebanon in 1982.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Rapid Fire! (Second Edition): Fast Play World War Two Wargames Rules

boardgame.name: Fontanero Chapucero
Plumber Pants
boardgame.description:
Oh no…the plumber is fixing a clog under the sink and he's getting pranked! His pants just might fall down…and that means everyone gets sprayed with water! In this plumber pants game, players take turns raiding his toolbox and loading The tools onto his belt. Be careful! If the plumber's pants fall down on a player's turn, water will spray from the sink, and that player will be out. The only player not to make his pants fall down wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Disappearance of Esme
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An idyllic little village, nestled in a scenic valley. A deep, dark forest nearby. A little girl who stepped into the woods and never returned. It all seems like something out of a fairy tale.

But not everything is as it seems! A group of heroes must venture into the Emerald Forest to bring Esme back. They will soon learn that 'bringing her back' entails much, much more than that.

A Twisted Fairy Tale
The Disappearance of Esme is a short adventure for four or five characters of 2nd to 4th level. It will take a party from an ancient forest to a magical island at the fringe of the Feywild to the Feywild itself.

As a standalone one shot, it is possible to complete it within a session of six+ hours. However, it is ideally played over two or even three sessions so that the players have time to absorb all that is happening and make decisions with more care. It can be placed within any setting where travel to the Feywild is a possibility.

Features

A painstakingly crafted 25 page full-color and fully illustrated PDF, a printer friendly B&W version, and a tested for screen readers accessible version
A customisable, standalone adventure with opportunities for exploration, skill challenges, NPC interactions and combat
Multiple entry and exit points, suggested developments for many different pathways
Well rounded, complex NPCs with old school portraits
Tooth Fairies, Flying Monkeys and Foglings: custom monsters with stat blocks
A colorful battle map with both DM and player versions and separate monster and environment art assets


Content Warning: The intended tone of this adventure is that of a creepy fairy tale. There are allusions to body horror, body morphing and children in peril. In Chapter 2, there is a paragraph that contains imagery of torture. A content warning appears before that paragraph.

boardgame.name: Under Siege
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the IX century, the feudal Lord Rouen, from north of France, received word of an incoming invasion of the Normans coming from the north.

He locked himself up in his highest tower, not trusting a single soul, knowing that even his servants might try to execute him to avoid conflict with the Normans.

Under Siege is a one-shot siege adventure written entirely in one page, where the players take the roles of invading Normans trying to find a way inside Rouan’s tower to finish him once and for all. You’re going to need a player to tell the story, a Game Master (GM) and 2 to 4 players to take the roles of the Norman warriors, the Playable Characters (PC).

boardgame.name: Neon Chase
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cyber mercenaries are not free from the relationships between their job hirers and in a world where your life values as much as your bank account, low class mercenaries are constantly being forced to fight among themselves the wars of others.

Neon Chase is a one-shot adventure written entirely in one page. You’re going to need a player to tell the story, the Game Master (GM) and 2 to 4 players to take the roles of the main characters who are mercenaries in a cyberpunk future, these are the Playable Characters (PC).

boardgame.name: Killer Coffee and Regicide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Atlanta is a city marked by social class segregation and disregard for the common folk, although it has always been like this it doesn’t mean every citizen takes it easily. When two criminal groups cross paths to impact in the current situation of the city, a group of unintended heroes might be the only hope to avoid complete chaos in Atlanta.

Killer Coffee and Regicide is a medieval fantasy one-page scenario based on the campaign played by the Roll Players’s Podcast.

boardgame.name: The City of the Insigne Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure module for Quest RPG. This scenario is intended to inspire and support players (Storyteller and Protagonists) to participate in an adventure that can be completed in a single session or even serve as a start for something bigger.

This scenario proposes a heroic medieval fantasy story. Players are expected to create characters that live in the city and possess some kind of connection to it. In addition, they are among the most capable of the city within their specialties. Therefore, the Storyteller is also expected to consider both of these aspects when making choices.

boardgame.name: Dry Spirits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dry Spirits is an one-shot adventure written entirely in one page, to be played with any generic RPG system. It is set in a low fantasy medieval scenario where the players take the roles of fishermen and hunters of a village going through hard times.

Background

It's already been months since the last time the village has had a proper meal for its villagers, hopefully the times of rain are approaching to bring back property to the soil, until then the fishermen and hunters need to feed the mouths of their people.

boardgame.name: These Empty Streets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine a normal day through your city, just the usual routine, from home to the subway, from the subway to work, and all the way back home when suddenly everything stops. You are alone now.

These Empty Streets is one-shot game written entirely in one page set in a contemporary urban setting where the main character finds himself deserted in his own city, completely alone out of a sudden.

The game is supposed to be played with any generic RPG system and it’s mainly focused in an one-to-one style of gaming (one Game Master (GM) and one Playable Character (PC)).

boardgame.name: A Ninja's Honor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Ninja's Honor is a One Shot Adventure entirely written in one page and free of RPG systems (system agnostic). The story it set in a Feudal Japan genre in the Edo Era where players take the roles of mercenaries/ninjas hired by a Feudal Lord (Daimyo) to get rid of rebelious leaders in the region.

Background Story

In the Edo Era the Nanbu Clan was a powerful legion that had the entire dominance of the northeast part of Japan and just like any powerhouses there are going to be rebellions inside their people. A group of Shinobi is hired by the Daimyo, Nanbu Naofusa, to get rid of the main leaders of the rebellion in the region.

Naofusa has been kidnapping and threatening men from small villages of the Nanbu region to go work in their farms. These men are treated pretty much like slaves, so some of them decided to flee and create a group that has been terrorizing rich towns around the land and killing nobles and guards.

As the players investigate they might choose to take the side of the farmers that want to kill the Daimyo or to finish the rebellion leaders and finish their jobs.

boardgame.name: Demon Factory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Demon Factory is a One Page Dungeon designed to be run in a medieval Fantasy genre.

Context:

The players have been summoned by the news that the region has been having a lot of problems with powerful demons spamming in large groups. By researching a bit the players find that the demons are coming from a dungeon one by one every one hour.

boardgame.name: Regrets in a Dark Corridor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a One Page Adventure supposed to be played in any RPG system with a Game Master (GM) and players. It wasn’t exactly written for a specific genre of scenario but it is most suitable for low fantasy and low technological settings to justify many of the choices made throughout the game. In this adventure it is presumed that the playable characters all must have a dark past which is going to be the main reason of their adversities.

BACKGROUND

The Heaven’s Peak mountains chain is a very wide range of mountains with huge heights and high slopes, in normal conditions no traveller would dare going through it and would just take the way around it even though it usually takes around two weeks to do so.

It just happens that our travelers are very important messengers of their kingdom and a war rapidly approaches, any second they save is a second more their kingdom has to prepare for war and that means everything.

One of the travelers though knows of old tales that tell of the ancient civilizations who built a straight passage through the mountains that only their own people knew how to use and every traveler that dared trying to go through it up to now has never been seen again.

By luck or maybe destiny our travelers happen to find the entrance to it, do they possess what it needs to be able to go through it?

boardgame.name: The Start of an Old World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a One Page Adventure supposed to be played in any RPG system with a Game Master (GM) and players. It's written for an investigative / survival-horror scenario that follows the main characters through an exploration in a newly colonized planet.

BACKGROUND

In the year of 2097 humanity has managed to reach a habitable exoplanet, although a very recent milestone, humanity doesn’t have time to lose, Earth is dying and people need a new home. The main characters of this story are going to be coworkers in the first colonizing base of this planet, each having different jobs but only one goal: To build a new home there.

Although the idea is full of hopes and dreams, the execution seems a little disturbed as the new planet seems to have a little bit more waiting for them than just a new home.

boardgame.name: Travelling Through The Wild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Traveling through the wild is not as easy as skipping scenes, there are rich Faunas and Floras in these environments that may cause a lot of trouble for travellers.

This is a simple guide on how to handle your campaign travels through the wild in a simple way without spending a lot of time on planning.

Given the right goal and background it may also be used as an One Shot adventure.

boardgame.name: Quest
‰∫ûÁëüÂÇ≥Â•á
boardgame.description:
In Quest, all will show their true colors as Good and Evil struggle for the future of civilization. Hidden amongst King Arthur’s loyal servants are Mordred’s unscrupulous minions. These forces of Evil are few in number, but if they go unknown, they can sabotage Arthur’s great quests.

Players are secretly dealt roles that determine if their allegiance is to Good or to Evil. Then, players debate, reason, and lie as they decide who to send on Quests—knowing that if just one minion of Mordred joins, the Quest could fail. Quest includes 25 different characters and many different ways to play the base game.

Quest also includes the Director's Cut, a personal recommendation from the designer about the preferred way to play Quest.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Errata:Page 7 of the rulebook should say: (for non-Director's Cut version)

Three successful Quests—Good wins! The game is over.

Note: When using the optional Blind Hunter, the Blind Hunter reveals themself and a Hunt occurs (see page8). There is no discussion, nor Good's Last Chance.

While the Blind Hunter is listed as optional, that role should always be included when including any named Good roles to provide a penalty for claiming. This (https://www.dropbox.com/s/7jw5t3x54up0jy0/Quest%20rulebook%2...) is a PDF of page 7 if you'd like to see how that fits into context, or want to print and include in your box.

The above Errata rule does not apply to the Director's Cut.

boardgame.name: Exceed: BlazBlue ‚Äì Ragna Box
boardgame.description:
Exceed Fighting System unleashes four brand new fighters from the acclaimed fighting game BlazBlue! Bring the fast-paced action of head-to-head arcade fighting games to your tabletop! Choose your fighter from an ever-growing roster of diverse characters, each with their own deck of special moves and supers. Exceed to reveal your true power and unleash havoc on your opponents!

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:


Ragna the Bloodedge - Ragna the Bloodedge is a fearless bruiser who seizes any opportunity to unleash an unrelenting offense. He'll continue his assault until his enemy is destroyed - no matter the cost!
Rachel Alucard - Rachel Alucard disdains direct combat, preferring that her minions handle the dirty work. She whittles opponents down with ranged attacks while staying out of reach with unparalleled mobility!
Iron Tager - Iron Tager is a huge, resilient grappler who moves slowly, but can use magnetism to pull distant opponents into range of incredibly punishing attacks!
Taokaka - Taokaka is an incredibly mobile rushdown fighter who can't sit still! She zips around the arena at high speeds, slashing at opponents and evading their attacks!‚Ä®


With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

—description from the publisher

With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

ν-13 - ν-13 is a swift, fragile zoner who constantly moves the fight toward extreme range. There, she has dominant advantages and can close games decisively!
Litchi Faye Ling - Litchi Faye-Ling manipulates her staff's position in conjunction with her attacks to create unrelenting pressure, or wields it directly to give herself greater range and more defensive options!

With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.description:
Exceed Fighting System unleashes four brand new fighters from the acclaimed fighting game BlazBlue! Bring the fast-paced action of head-to-head arcade fighting games to your tabletop! Choose your fighter from an ever-growing roster of diverse characters, each with their own deck of special moves and supers. Exceed to reveal your true power and unleash havoc on your opponents!
 
This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play: 


Hazama - Hazama is a patient zoner who uses deceptive mobility tools to frustrate opponents and deplete their resources while keeping out of reach.
Nine The Phantom - Nine the Phantom is a highly technical spellcaster who curates her available moves as the game progresses. With careful forethought, she can tailor her offense to any foe!
Kokonoe - Kokonoe Mercury is a resource-hungry gadgeteer with highly situational attacks. With time and careful spacing, however, she can create unbeatable setups with unparalleled power!
Platinum the Trinity - Platinum the Trinity is a flexible all-rounder whose abilities shift as the battle progresses. By swiftly adapting to her own ever-changing playstyle, she can wield a variety of advantages at unpredictable times!


With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!
